page.title: 10Trade
page.content:
There are several shops in Upper Heyford village. On the main road is the County Stores and in the lower part of the village is an old Victorian chapel converted to a Village Stores.
There are two pubs in the village, the Barley Mow and The Three Horseshoes.
There is a large garage on the main road which houses the coach company of Heyfordian Coaches.This company provides local school transport and coaches for outings. Its principal trade however comes from arranging and providing transport for foreign tours.
Several other businesses are to be found on, the air base.
